title: Banishead Quarry Walking Route

nearby.description: Old Man of Coniston Circular Walk

images.title: Les Hull / Banishead Quarry
images.caption: Banishead Quarry. Wainwright refers to this quarry as Banishead or Banniside which is on the route to Coniston Old Man from Tover and can be tackled from Little Arrow. He mentions it in his Southern Fells, Pictorial Guide and is Route 9 passing Goat's Water on the way to the summit.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Rough Pasture Near Torver Beck
images.caption: Rough Pasture Near Torver Beck

images.title: Mick Garratt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Luke's Church, Torver

images.title: Peter Bond / Church House Inn, Torver
images.caption: Church House Inn, Torver

description: This walk visits the Banishead Quarry near Coniston in the Lake District. The walk starts in Torver and follows bridle paths north up to the quarries. On the way there's nice views of the Torver Beck with waterfalls and woodland areas too. It's a fairly challenging climb with the quarries sitting in an elevated position above Coniston Water. At the site there's a picturesque pool and a waterfall to admire.
